intro: Catabrosa caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. It features oval, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive central cluster of stamens.
